chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah E. BEHNKE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18, except for his own children with the approval of the agent.

Complete psycho-sex evaluation and comply with recommendations.

Have no contact with the victim or her family.  

If during probation, the child loses her insurance, defendant will be responsible for the payment of her counseling and medications.  

Register as sex offender and comply with sex offender registry.  

Submit DNA sample. 

Defendant is not to possess or own any internet enabled device without the agent's approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
State files an Amended Information charging 1 ct. Sexual Assault of Child under 16 years of age, contrary to Section 948.02(2), a Class C felony and 1 ct. Bail Jumping, contrary to Section 946.49(1), a Class A misdemeanor.   Motion granted.  
Count 1 - Sexual assault of child under 16 years of age - No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 2, bail jumping.   Motion granted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC along with a psycho-sexual evaluation.   Report to be filed by 12-18-15.   Sentencing hearing is set for 01-08-16 at 1:30 p.m.   Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights. 
Minutes.
Plea Date set for 10-14-2015 at 10:30 a.m., Br. 1.
From ADA Vendetti to Judge Rohrer

Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Notice of Motion; Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-01-15 at 9:30 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.   
Minutes.

From Atty. J. Vendetti to Judge Rohrer, dated 04-24-2015.
RE: Adjournment

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-28-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 1st degree sexual assault of child and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 04-13-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 except for his children M.B., DOB: 12-09-12, A.B., DOB: 11-12-14 with adult supervisionand no contact with M.M.B., DOB: 09-17-2003, J.B., DOB: 02-08-1977 or the residence at 2634 S. 21st Street, Manitowoc, WI and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
